text: a vast sea of red mud engulf the
industrial complex buildings were left
barely standing 14 factories were
swamped two office blocks dormitories
for workers phone footage captured the
moment of impact on lookers watched and
then realize they might be next in line
they fled in panic a major rescue
operation is underway to try to locate
anyone who might have survived in air
pockets below the sea of mud initially
bare hands were used now mechanical
diggers have taken over shantamma soil
the movie are to the Jorah this local
official says the top priority is to
save people and to prevent further
disasters but away from the scene some
local media are raising the question of
why it happened local papers are quoting
residents who say the wastes should
never have been stored at a quarry above
the industrial complex Shenzhen was a
sleepy fishing town 30 years ago today
it is a major industrial area the
phenomenal economic growth meant
breakneck construction some in China
asked if safety was given a high enough
priority Stephen Evans BBC News Beijing
